content.user_title: Test React Native apps with Jest
content.value_statement: Writing tests for React Native applications is time-consuming without proper templates and patterns. This skill provides ready-to-use testing templates for components, hooks, and utilities along with mocking patterns and best practices.
actual_capabilities: Provides component test templates using React Native Testing Library
Provides hook test templates with renderHook and act utilities
Provides utility test templates for pure functions
Shows mocking patterns for external modules, databases, and navigation
Includes async testing patterns and form testing examples
Lists troubleshooting tips for common testing issues
limitations: Does not execute tests or verify test results
Does not configure Jest or testing infrastructure automatically
Does not generate test coverage reports
Does not integrate with CI/CD pipelines

output_examples.input: Write a test for a LoginForm component that validates email input
output: Import render and fireEvent from testing library
Render LoginForm with testID props for reliable selection
Use fireEvent.changeText to simulate user input
Use fireEvent.press to trigger form submission
Assert that error messages appear for invalid input
Verify form validation logic works correctly

output_examples.input: How do I test a custom hook that fetches data?
output: Use renderHook to render the hook with initial props
Use act to wrap state updates from the hook
Use findBy queries to wait for async content
Assert the rendered output matches expected data
Test loading and error states as well

output_examples.input: Create a test for a list component that renders items
output: Create mock data array with test items
Render list component with mock items
Use getAllByTestId to find all rendered items
Assert the correct number of items are rendered
Verify item content matches mock data

best_practices: Test user-facing behavior instead of internal implementation details
Use testID props for element selection instead of fragile text queries
Mock external dependencies to keep tests fast and isolated
anti_patterns: Testing implementation details instead of user behavior
Using text queries that break with UI changes
Skipping mocking of external services causing flaky tests

faq.question: Which React Native versions are supported?
faq.answer: Works with React Native 0.70+ and Expo SDK 50+. Compatible with Jest 28+ and React Native Testing Library.

faq.question: What is the maximum test file size?
faq.answer: No enforced limit. Keep tests focused with one concern per file. Large components may need multiple test files.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: The skill provides guidance for running Jest in CI. Add npm test to your CI pipeline configuration.

faq.question: Is test data stored securely?
faq.answer: Tests run locally. No test data leaves your machine. Jest stores coverage reports locally by default.

faq.question: Why are my tests timing out?
faq.answer: Increase Jest timeout, check for unresolved promises, use waitFor or findBy queries for async content.

faq.question: How is this different from Detox for E2E testing?
faq.answer: Jest with RNTL tests units and components in isolation. Detox tests full app flow on simulator. Use both together.
